panels.description: Displays the desired number of replicas of the application, which you define when you create the Deployment. This is the desired state.
panels.title: Desired Pods

panels.description: Displays how many replicas are currently running
panels.title: Current Pods

panels.description: Displays how many replicas of the application are available to your users.
panels.title: Available Pods

panels.description: Displays summary of all container restarts in given interval
panels.title: Container Restarts

panels.description: Pending changes on the deployment
panels.title: Pending Deployment

panels.description: How old is deployment
panels.title: Last Deployment

panels.description: Displays CPU average usage in cores per deployment
panels.title: CPU Usage (deployment)

panels.description:
Displays Mem average usage in bytes per pod.

WSS/OOM:
The amount of working set memory, this includes recently accessed memory,dirty memory, and kernel memory.

Usage:
Current memory usage, this includes all memory regardless of when it was accessed.

RSS:
The amount of anonymous and swap cache memory, includes transparent hugepages). Real memory pages that are currently mapped.

Cache:
Number of bytes of page cache memory.
panels.title: Mem Usage (deployment)

panels.description: Displays requests per second by controller
panels.title: Request Rate by Controller

panels.description: Displays connections per second by controller
panels.title: Connections by Controller

panels.description: Displays the requests length (including request line, header, and request body) per second
panels.title: Request Bandwidth by Controller

panels.description: Displays the response length (including request line, header, and request body) per second
panels.title: Response Bandwidth by Controller

panels.description: Displays requests per second by controller
panels.title: Request Rate by Ingress

panels.description: Displays percentage comparing total requests with 5xx

targets.expr: sum(rate(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{cluster="$Cluster", controller_namespace="$Namespace",controller_class="$ControllerClass", controller_pod=~"$Controller", ingress!="" ,status=~"[5][0-9][0-9]"}[1m])) by (ingress) / sum(rate(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{cluster="$Cluster", controller_namespace="$Namespace",controller_class="$ControllerClass", controller_pod=~"$Controller", ingress!=""}[1m])) by (ingress)

panels.title: Request Error Rate by Ingress

panels.description: Displays the requests length (including request line, header, and request body) per second
panels.title: Request Bandwidth by Ingress

panels.description: Displays the response length (including request line, header, and request body) per second
panels.title: Response Bandwidth by Ingress

panels.description: Displays CPU average usage in cores per pod
panels.title: CPU Usage (pod)

panels.description: Displays CPU average usage in cores per pod and container

targets.expr: sum(rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$Deployment.+", image!~".+pause.+", container!=""}[1m])) by (pod, container)

panels.title: CPU Usage (pod/container)

panels.description:
Displays Requests  and/or Limits per container

Guaranteed QoS: 
Every Container in the Pod must have a memory limit and a memory request, and they must be the same.Every Container in the Pod must have a CPU limit and a CPU request, and they must be the same.

Burstable Qos:
The Pod does not meet the criteria for QoS class Guaranteed.At least one Container in the Pod has a memory or CPU request

BestEffort QoS:
Pod must not have any memory or CPU limits or requests.

targets.expr: max(label_join(kube_pod_container_resource_requests_cpu_cores{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$Deployment.+"}, "pod_container", "/", "pod", "container")) by (pod_container) or on() vector(-1)

max(label_join(kube_pod_container_resource_limits_cpu_cores{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$Deployment.+"}, "pod_container", "/", "pod", "container")) by (pod_container) or on() vector(-1)

panels.title: CPU Requests/Limits

panels.description: Displays Throttled CPU  in cores per pod and container when container is in Guaranteed QoS

targets.expr: sum(rate(container_cpu_cfs_throttled_seconds_total{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$Deployment.+", image!~".+pause.+"}[1m])) by (pod, container) or on() vector(0)

panels.title: CPU Throttled (pod/container)

panels.description:
Displays Mem average usage in bytes per pod.

WSS/OOM:
The amount of working set memory, this includes recently accessed memory,dirty memory, and kernel memory.

Usage:
Current memory usage, this includes all memory regardless of when it was accessed.

RSS:
The amount of anonymous and swap cache memory, includes transparent hugepages). Real memory pages that are currently mapped.

Cache:
Number of bytes of page cache memory.
panels.title: Mem Usage (pod)

panels.description:
Displays Mem average usage in bytes per pod and container.

WSS/OOM:
The amount of working set memory, this includes recently accessed memory,dirty memory, and kernel memory.

Usage:
Current memory usage, this includes all memory regardless of when it was accessed.

RSS:
The amount of anonymous and swap cache memory, includes transparent hugepages). Real memory pages that are currently mapped.

Cache:
Number of bytes of page cache memory.

targets.expr: sum(container_memory_working_set_bytes{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$Deployment.+", image!~".+pause.+", container!=""}) by (pod, container)
sum(container_memory_usage_bytes{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$Deployment.+", image!~".+pause.+", container!=""}) by (pod, container)
sum(container_memory_rss{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$Deployment.+", image!~".+pause.+", container!=""}) by (pod, container)
sum(container_memory_cache{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$Deployment.+", image!~".+pause.+", container!=""}) by (pod, container)

panels.title: Mem Usage (pod/container)

panels.description:
Displays Requests  and/or Limits per container

Guaranteed QoS: 
Every Container in the Pod must have a memory limit and a memory request, and they must be the same.Every Container in the Pod must have a CPU limit and a CPU request, and they must be the same.

Burstable Qos:
The Pod does not meet the criteria for QoS class Guaranteed.At least one Container in the Pod has a memory or CPU request

BestEffort QoS:
Pod must not have any memory or CPU limits or requests.

targets.expr: max(label_join(kube_pod_container_resource_requests_mem_bytes{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$Deployment.+"}, "pod_container", "/", "pod", "container")) by (pod_container) or on() vector(-1)

max(label_join(kube_pod_container_resource_limits_mem_bytes{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$Deployment.+"}, "pod_container", "/", "pod", "container")) by (pod_container) or on() vector(-1)

panels.title: Mem Requests/Limits

panels.description: Displays number of memory usage hits limits

targets.expr: sum(rate(container_memory_failcnt{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$Deployment.+", image!~".+pause.+", container!~"(POD|)"}[1m])) by (pod, container)

panels.title: Memory Failures

targets.expr: sum(rate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$Deployment.+", container!~"(POD|)"}[1m])) by (pod, container) or on() vector(0)
sum(rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{cluster="$Cluster", namespace="$Namespace", pod=~"$Deployment.+", container!~"(POD|)"}[1m])) by (pod, container) or on() vector(0)
